intro: Eustylis intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate eustylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Eustylis intermedia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
